articles.author: Bill Chappell
articles.title: How has the Electoral College survived, despite being perennially unpopular? - NPR
articles.description: Despite its substantial-sounding name, the Electoral College isn’t a permanent body: It’s more of a process. For decades, a majority of Americans have wanted it to be changed.
articles.content:
Every presidential election cycle, constitutional law expert Alison LaCroix can count on people asking her one question when they learn what she does for a living.

articles.title: Fossil of Huge Terror Bird Found in Colombia - Sci.News
